intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. caesioprasinum, commonly known as the greenish hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring temperate climates. The plant features basal leaves that are lanceolate and often have a hairy surface. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in a single head, with ray florets that are usually greenish in color. It is part of the Asteraceae family and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture.
